meanings.definition: To make a buzzing or humming noise.
meanings.sent1: The bees bombinate around the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the machine bombinate as it worked in the background.
meanings.sent3: The bombinating sound of the fan put me to sleep in no time.
meanings.sent4: The city bombinates with life and energy, never truly silent.
meanings.sent5: The bombinating of the cicadas filled the summer air with a soothing melody.

meanings.sent1: The bombinate of the bees was a constant background noise in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The bombinate of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The bombinate of the refrigerator seemed to lull the cat into a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent4: The bombinate of the city was a symphony of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The bombinate of the wind through the trees created a calming atmosphere in the forest.
